titles.ar: باب أَنَّهُ يُبْدَأُ بِالْكَفَنِ ثُمَّ بِالدَّيْنِ ثُمَّ بِالْوَصِيَّةِ
titles.en: Chapter 17 – It  shall begin with the shroud, then the debts, then with the bequest

titles.ar: باب أَنَّهُ يُبْدَأُ بِالْكَفَنِ ثُمَّ بِالدَّيْنِ ثُمَّ بِالْوَصِيَّةِ
titles.en: Chapter 17 – It  shall begin with the shroud, then the debts, then with the bequest

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ الْكَفَنُ مِنْ جَمِيعِ الْمَالِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Abdullah Bin Sinan, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The shroud is from the entirety of the wealth (legacy)’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ مُعَاذٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مَاتَ وَ عَلَيْهِ دَيْنٌ بِقَدْرِ ثَمَنِ كَفَنِهِ فَقَالَ يُجْعَلُ مَا تَرَكَ فِي ثَمَنِ كَفَنِهِ إِلَّا أَنْ يَتَّجِرَ عَلَيْهِ بَعْضُ النَّاسِ فَيُكَفِّنَهُ وَ يُقْضَى مَا عَلَيْهِ مِمَّا تَرَكَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad and Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, both together from Ibn Mahboub, from Ali Bin Raib, from Moaz, from Zurara who said, 
‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about a man who died and upon him was a debt to the value of the price of the shroud. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He should make whatever he leaves to be regarding his shroud, except if one of the people were to trade with him, so they shroud him, and pay off what is upon him from whatever he leaves (as a legacy)’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ أَوَّلُ شَيْ‏ءٍ يُبْدَأُ بِهِ مِنَ الْمَالِ الْكَفَنُ ثُمَّ الدَّيْنُ ثُمَّ الْوَصِيَّةُ ثُمَّ الْمِيرَاثُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, form his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakuny, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The first thing to begin with from the wealth (legacy) is the shroud, then the debts, then the bequest, then the inheritance’.
